channel.title: SCAR on a mac?
channel.description: i cant get it to work! does it even work on mac?

item.title: SCAR on a mac?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

slinkyman24:

There is a way for mac’s to read java script my friend did it ill have to find out and maybe ill post

Java is a multi-platformed programming language. SCAR, however requires windows functions.

item.title: SCAR on a mac?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“hello to you all, post:12, topic:24623”]The last sentence really made me laugh. Most of the people that are on the computer are adults at work. There boss got them an anti-virus that he thought was good based on reviews. By adults. Most people here that don’t like a software on the reviews have never tried it. I have tried a mac at toys-r-us and it crashed. Probably a shit one but who cares.

Windows for example, take a look at Ron’s tutorials.[/quote]

im glad that i made u laugh but i work in pc world and yeh its true that some/most macs do crash on you very often…
but if you know how to use them then they are actually quite handy…

you see the thin gwith macs is that they are computers for bussiness (which im sure you knew)
so when you try play games etc then the mac crashes…

but there are plenty of programs that stop macs from crashing!
[/quote]

Macs are for home users, and windows for ‘bussiness’, they made that very obvious in there adverts.

Read full topic

item.title: SCAR on a mac?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“hello to you all, post:8, topic:24623”]just go buy the software called ‘Windows for Mac’ from pc world!!

it costs about 50gbp and you can then use SCAR and cheat on runescape :))

and btw Macs dont crash if you know what your doing ;)[/quote]

The last sentence really made me laugh. Most of the people that are on the computer are adults at work. There boss got them an anti-virus that he thought was good based on reviews. By adults. Most people here that don’t like a software on the reviews have never tried it. I have tried a mac at toys-r-us and it crashed. Probably a shit one but who cares.

Windows for example, take a look at Ron’s tutorials.

Read full topic
